intro: Mentha despecta, commonly known as the purple mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a distinct minty scent. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually violet or purple in color, appearing in whorls along the stem. Mentha despecta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
